bug.author: dnuske
bug.summary: Assorted bugs when closing Streamlit still running throws error
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Closing Streamlit throws errors. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Situation 1: 1 Run an example streamlit run examples/images.py 2 Close browser tab after it opens. 3 Error on shell: AttributeError: '_FolderEventHandler' object has no attribute 'watch' Situation 2: 1 Run tutorial code without cache decorator 2 The histogram is rendered in the browser 3 Error appears on shell: ValueError: The default valueof 24 must lie between themin_value of 17 and the \max_value` of 1, inclusively.` Situation 3: 1 Run an example streamlit run examples/images.py 2 hit ctrl+c 3 Streamlit does not release shell and throws error: AttributeError: '_FolderEventHandler' object has no attribute 'watch' <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Should not throw errors, should stop when hit ctrl+c key. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Exceptions appear in the terminal. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.45 Python version: Python 3.7/Python 2.7.15 Using: Conda OS version: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS Browser version: Not specified
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
The environment does not have watchdog available.

comments.comment: Unable to reproduce scenario 1, 2, 3 or 4. The only difference was that I ran this on a Docker based Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. Everything else was the same.

edited the issue, moved situation 3 to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/330>#330</denchmark-link> . The remaining scenarios were reproduced on the specified environment and a PR with the fix was created.
